title: Looking for font similar to "Stocnia Gdansk" shipyard entrance sign
content:
People, anyone recognise the font used at the Gdansk shipyard in Poland?  
Is there a similar font anyone can think of?

Any suggestions greatly appreciated!  
Cheers

Terry

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [gdansk.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20061130180122/http:/typophile.com/files/gdansk.jpg) | 59.03 KB |
| [gdansk2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20061130180122/http:/typophile.com/files/gdansk2.jpg) | 72.23 KB |
author: tscruby

comments.content:
It’s got an odd mix with the round G (like Eagle), and the oval O. Obviously not the work of a type designer. Overall, I might suggest a heavy weight of Avant Garde Gothic, with a customized G and O.

- Mike Yanega

Cheers Mike,

Yep - I was having problems trying to find something suitably shoddy! I want to try and recreate that industrial homemade feel so mixing and matching will probably do the trick.

Thanks,  
Terry
